Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Temporin-PE (Leu-rich; natural AMPs; edible frog, amphibians, animals; Leu-rich; XXA; UCLL1c )

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 92.3% similarity toTemporin-1P. GRAVY = 1.97; Mol. Wt: 1383.781. Rich in leucine (38%).Activity: Active against S. aureus (MIC 2 uM), MRSA (MIC 4 uM) E. coli (MIC 16 uM), E. faecalis (MIC 8 uM), and C. albicans (MIC 4 uM). It also showed cytotoxic effects on cancer cells NCI-H157, U251MG, PC-3, MDA-MB-435s with poor cell selectivity. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Sang M, Wu Q, Xi X, Ma C, Wang L, Zhou M, Burrows JF, Chen T.2018
Literature Information.Reference: Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2018 Jan 22;495(4):2539-2546. doi: 10.1016/j.bbrc.2017.11.173.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Identification and target-modifications of temporin-PE: A novel antimicrobial peptide in the defensive skin secretions of the edible frog, Pelophylax kl. esculentus.
